cab.content: [This Document is the Property of His Britannic Majesty's Government.] (Printed for the Cabinet. September 1922.)SECRET. CP. 4210. CABINET.I circulate the following telegram, which has been received from India.22nd September 1922. PEEL. From Viceroy to the Secretary of State for India, 15th September .1922. A meeting of the Muslim members-of the Indian Legislature passed thefollowing Resolution and transmitted it to me : " This meeting, representing 70 millions of His Majesty's Indian Muslimsubjects, is sincerely convinced that the conclusion of an honourable peace,whereby Turkish Empire will retain Asia Minor and Thrace, includingAdrianople, with guarantees for the protection of minorities, wherebyInternational control over Constantinople and the Straits should be removed,with guarantees for the freedom of the latter, and whereby the religiousposition of the Sultan as Caliph of Islam should be duly recognised, isessential to the restoration of peace in the Near and Middle East, and tomutual co-operation and goodwill in it."5740 100 9.22
